alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Geneva; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Dale, southeastern Coffee, Geneva and western Houston Counties through 1015 AM CDT... At 929 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Samson, or 7 miles northwest of Geneva, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Daleville, Dothan, Geneva, Enterprise, Fort Rucker, Hartford, Taylor, Midland City, Kinsey, Level Plains, Slocomb, Samson, Newton, Pinckard, Malvern, Rehobeth, Clayhatchee, Grimes, Napier Field and Madrid. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
